newsitem.headline: Debt relief a step closer
newsitem.story: The Albanese government's student debt-slashing bill has passed through the House of Representatives with support from the Coalition, after Sussan Ley confirmed the opposition would not stand in the way. Coalition support is crucial in the Senate, where Labor does not hold a majority and the Greens have threatened to stall it. Labor's Bill was central to its youth-focused re-election pitch. It would cut student debts by 20 per cent for some three million graduates, or wipe off about $5500 from the average debt.
